property.name: text
property.value: Adding Mount Table and Camera Assemply Inertia)to the motor rotor Inertia. (Direct Drive setup)

property.name: text
property.value: Simulation of Tracking Mount Motor Control

property.name: description
property.value:
Model of a motor. The inputs are the voltage applied to the motor and the torque (if any) applied by the load. If the load is a passive mass connected to the motor, then it applies no active torque. The moment of inertia of the load plus the motor should be specified in the I parameter. The outputs are angular velocity (in RPM) and current (in amps) that flows through the motor.

Icon image: "Electric motor cycle 2". Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 via Wikimedia Commons - original file

property.name: author
property.value: Patricia Derler and Edward A. Lee

property.name: kb (parameter)
property.value: The back electromagnetic force constant in volts/RPM.

property.name: kT (parameter)
property.value: The torque constant of the motor (an emperical quantity) in newton*meters/amps.

property.name: R (parameter)
property.value: The winding resistance of the motor in ohms.

property.name: I (parameter)
property.value: The moment of inertia in kg*meters^2. The default value is a reasonable value for a small motor with no connected load.

property.name: loadTorque (port)
property.value: The torque, if any, imposed by the load. Leave disconnected or provide 0.0 for a passive load.

property.name: angularVelocity (port)
property.value: The angular velocity in revolutions per minute (RPM)

property.name: current (port)
property.value: The current that flows through the motor.

property.name: latex
property.value:
$ \text{Motor speed is determined by the torque $\tau_m$ induced by the motor current,}\\ \text{applied external torque $(\tau_e)$ and moment of inertia ($M_r$) of the rotor.} \\ \tau_m - \tau_e = M_r \frac{d\omega}{dt} \\
\text{Motor current is related to supply voltage ($V_s$), induced back emf ($V_b$)} \\ \text{and inductuance ($L_s$) of the stator winding} \\ V_s - V_b = L_s \frac{di}{dt} \\
\text{Further the values of ($V_b$) and ($\tau_m$) can be related empirically to} \\ \text{motor speed ($\omega$) and motor current ($i$) as follows} \\ \tau_m = k_T i \\ V_b = k_b \omega \\ $

property.name: text
property.value:
Power Input = 655W (stalled) Peak Torque = 40 * 1.356 N.m No Load Speed = 12 rad/s No. of Poles = 20 Motor Weight = 24 lb Electrical Time Const = 3ms (?) Temp. Rise 0.75C/W Motor Constant = 1.56 * 1.356 N.m / sqrt(Watt)
Wining: VStall = 39.2V, IPeak = 16.7A

property.name: text
property.value: An integrator with windup reset specified by min and max parameters. When the output of the integrator output is not within the limits it will pause integration until the input move in a direction to move it away from the clipped limits. Useful in PID controllers
